text: this was a five-story building that had
collapsed down to just an amount amount
of rubble which was about three maybe
four meters high and it was solid
compacted concrete and rubble and bricks
that has been rained on for 24 hours so
it was incredibly heavy the local army
were searching the area today merely
clearing it out when they heard
something they called in American and
French search and rescue teams who were
nearby who brought in hydraulic jacks to
try and lift up the area and clear the
area they dug down about two to three
meters and found a little tiny hole no
bigger than half a meter by half a meter
square and inside was this teenage boy
he had a sheet of metal stuck into his
back he was lying on his front but had
managed to shout for help
the rescue operation involves peeling
back the piece of metal to free him and
then making handing brick by brick
between a huge line of officers as they
as they tried to clear enough space to
be able to pull him through
medics went down a lot of certain
recipes probably around two to three
hundred rescuers were there at the end
and they managed to get him out put him
on a stretcher and take him out and when
they turned the corner in front of them
they found a crowd of about two thousand
people cheering their heads off as the
boy was led to an ambulance and taken
off to hospital at staggering site and
as you say it came exactly almost the
minute five year five days after the
quake happened
